titleStmt.title: Variants of the bound pronoun 2nd person plural masculine
titleStmt.author: Veronika Engler

sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for the 2nd person plural masculine bound pronoun.

revisionDesc.change: For EGY-___ there are no values found
updating references to Zotero IDs via update-bibl-refs.xsl

wib:featureValueObservation.note: Very old speakers (70+) show -kum, old speakers (60+) show variation between -kum and -ku, middle age speakers show variation between -ku and -kun, being -ku more frequent, and young speakers show -kun. However, -ku and -kun are 2.pl.comunis, and not 2.pl.masc.
-ku is used both for 2.pl.masc and 2.pl.fem. but when a negation is attached, the forms -kūš (masc.) - kinniš (fem.) are attested.
in Ḥāyil the attested form is -kam
it is less and less used by younger generation
the form -kom occurrs in free variation with -kum
-ḳuw and -kuw are also recorded but occur less.
-ḳuw also exists but it is less common
-ḳuw also exists but it is less common
-ḳuw also exists but it is less common
-ḳuw also exists but it is less common
-ḳuw also exists but it is less common
-ḳuw also exists but it is less common
